meanings.definition: To move with a splashing or swashing sound.
meanings.sent1: The waves swashes against the shore.
meanings.sent2: She swashes the mop back and forth to clean the floor.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy swashes water everywhere during bath time.
meanings.sent4: The wind swashes through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The rain swashes against the window, lulling me to sleep.

meanings.sent1: The swashes of the fountain added a refreshing touch to the garden.
meanings.sent2: I heard the swashes of the river as I approached.
meanings.sent3: The chef added the final touch to the dish with a swashes of sauce.
meanings.sent4: The swashes of the waterfall echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The swashes of the paintbrush brought life to the canvas.

meanings.definition: A decorative flourish or ornamental scroll in writing or printing.
meanings.sent1: The invitation was adorned with elegant swashes and curls.
meanings.sent2: The certificate had intricate swashes around the border.
meanings.sent3: The calligrapher added a playful swashes to the lettering.
meanings.sent4: The book cover featured golden swashes that caught the eye.
meanings.sent5: The artist signed the painting with a unique swashes.

meanings.definition: To make a showy or swaggering display.
meanings.sent1: He swashes into the room, commanding attention with his presence.
meanings.sent2: The peacock swashes its feathers to impress the peahens.
meanings.sent3: The actor swashes across the stage, stealing the spotlight.
meanings.sent4: She swashes through the party, turning heads with her confidence.
meanings.sent5: The knight swashes into battle, ready to conquer the enemy.
